verses.roman:
kṣaṇe kṣaṇe uṭhe premāra taraṅga ananta
jīva chāra kāhāṅ tāra pāibeka anta?

synonyms: kṣaṇe kṣaṇe—moment after moment; uṭhe—rise; premāra—of love of Kṛṣṇa; taraṅga—waves; ananta—unlimited; jīva—a living entity; chāra—insignificant; kāhāṅ—where; tāra—of that; pāibeka—will get; anta—the limit.
translation: Endless waves arise moment after moment in that ocean of love. How could an insignificant living entity estimate their limits?
